00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodMultiDataCCCHPReport.h
00024  * @author David Le
00025  * @date   Wed Mar 15 12:46:53 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Reporter for genotyping probe sets that outputs chp files. There is
00028  * one CC CHP file produced for each cel file and the order of the CC CHP file is
00029  * guarenteed to be the same as the cdf file. It is very important that the
00030  * number and order of the probeset results is the exact same as the CDF
00031  * file. There have been a number of high impact bugs on this front and it is
00032  * important to be very careful.
00033  */
00034 
00035 #ifndef QUANTMETHODGTYPECCCHPREPORT_H
00036 #define QUANTMETHODGTYPECCCHPREPORT_H
00037 
00038 //
00039 #include "chipstream/AnalysisInfo.h"
00040 #include "chipstream/ChipSummary.h"
00041 #include "chipstream/QuantExprMethod.h"
00042 #include "chipstream/QuantGTypeMethod.h"
00043 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodReport.h"
00044 //
00045 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/CalvinCHPMultiDataFileBufferWriter.h"
00046 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/CalvinCHPMultiDataFileWriter.h"
00047 #include "util/Err.h"
00048 #include "util/Util.h"
00049 //
00050 #include <cfloat>
00051 #include <iostream>
00052 //
00053 
00054 class QuantMethodMultiDataCCCHPReport : public QuantMethodReport {
00055 public: 
00056   /** Constructor. */
00057 QuantMethodMultiDataCCCHPReport(const std::string& prefix)
00058   {
00059       m_Prefix = prefix;
00060       m_ProcessedProbeSetCount = 0;
00061       m_ProcessedExprProbeSetCount = 0;
00062       m_ProcessedGTypeProbeSetCount = 0;
00063       nGenotype = 0;
00064       nExpression = 0;
00065       nReporting = 0;
00066       genoTypeOnly = true;
00067       m_output_chip_view_md5sum=true;
00068       m_ProbeSetsToReport = NULL;
00069   }
00070 
00071   /** Destructor. */
00072   ~QuantMethodMultiDataCCCHPReport() { }
00073 
00074   /**
00075    * Set the CHP filenames to use for output. This overrides any prefix and allows
00076    * the caller to place the chp files anyplace they are desired.
00077    * @param fileNames - Vector of fileNames with full path to output
00078    * file, one for each cel file.
00079    */
00080   void setChpFileNames(std::vector<std::string> &fileNames) {
00081     m_CHPFileNames = fileNames;
00082   }
00083 
00084   /** 
00085    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00086    * streams and print headers to files etc.
00087    * 
00088    * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00089    * 
00090    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00091    */
00092   bool prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00093 
00094   /** 
00095    * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00096    * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00097    * 
00098    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00099    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00100    * 
00101    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00102    */
00103   bool report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00104               QuantMethod &qMethod,
00105               const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00106               std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00107               PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00108 
00109   /** 
00110    * For genotyping CHP files GTYPE likes to have the median of the raw intensity
00111    * probes stuffed into the confidence field of the CHP files. I'm not sure why
00112    * but Richard C asked for it so here it is.
00113    * 
00114    * @param psGroup - Groupt of probes.
00115    * @param iMart - Raw intensity data for chips.
00116    * @param chipIx - Which chip we are taking the median for.
00117    * 
00118    * @return median of all raw intensities for the PM probes in psGroup.
00119    */
00120   float medianOfPmProbes(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, int chipIx);
00121 
00122   /** 
00123    * If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is
00124    * called rather than the normal report call above. By default does nothing.
00125    * 
00126    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00127    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00128    * 
00129    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00130    */
00131    bool reportFailure(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00132                       QuantMethod &qMethod,
00133                       const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00134                       std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00135                       PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00136 
00137   /** 
00138    * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00139    * results and clean up.
00140    * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00141    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00142    */
00143   bool finish(QuantMethod &qMethod);
00144   
00145   /** The list of types to load */
00146   void SetGenoTypeOnly(bool genoOnly) { genoTypeOnly = genoOnly; }
00147 
00148   /**
00149    * Register a Chip Summary interface instance to pull metrics from
00150    */
00151   void registerChipSummary(ChipSummary *summary) {
00152       m_ChipSummaries.push_back(summary);
00153   }
00154 
00155   virtual void addStdHeaders(QuantMethodReport *qReport,
00156                              const std::string& execGuid, 
00157                              const std::string& reportGuid,
00158                              const std::string& timeStr,
00159                              const std::string& commandLine,
00160                              const std::string& execVersion,
00161                              const AnalysisInfo& info);
00162 
00163   void registerProbeSetsToReport(std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *probeSetsToReport) {
00164       m_ProbeSetsToReport = probeSetsToReport;
00165   }
00166 
00167 
00168 private:
00169   void removeAllChps();
00170   void removeTmpChps();
00171   /** Do a check that the original id we wrote out and the one that
00172       actually came with the probeset group match. */
00173   void checkCurrentId(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup) {
00174       if(ToStr(psGroup.probeSets[0]->name) != ToStr(m_Info.m_ProbesetNames[m_ProcessedProbeSetCount])) {
00175           Err::errAbort(ToStr("QuantMethodMultiDataCCCHPReport::report() - Expecting probeset: ") +
00176                   m_Info.m_ProbesetNames[m_ProcessedProbeSetCount] + ToStr(" got: ") +
00177                   ToStr(psGroup.probeSets[0]->name) + " at index: " + ToStr(m_ProcessedProbeSetCount));
00178       }
00179     }
00180 
00181   /** The number of expression probe sets */
00182   int nExpression;
00183   
00184   /** The number of genotyping probe sets */
00185   int nGenotype;
00186 
00187   /** The number of probe sets being reported*/
00188   int nReporting;
00189 
00190   /** The list of types to load */
00191   bool genoTypeOnly;
00192 
00193   /** Swap out the .cel for .chp */
00194   void setupFileNames(const IntensityMart &iMart);
00195 
00196   /// Our prefix to filenames, often a path.
00197   std::string m_Prefix;
00198 
00199   /// Our algorithm name. Will be appended before .chp, i.e. mycel.cel-> mycel.algName.chp
00200   std::string m_AlgName;
00201 
00202   /// How many probesets have we seen this far?
00203   int m_ProcessedProbeSetCount;
00204   int m_ProcessedExprProbeSetCount;
00205   int m_ProcessedGTypeProbeSetCount;
00206   /// Names of all of our cel files
00207   std::vector<std::string> m_CELFileNames;
00208   /// Names of all of our chp files, one for each cel file.
00209   std::vector<std::string> m_CHPFileNames;
00210   /// Names of all of our chp files used by buffer writer
00211   std::vector<std::string> m_TmpChpFiles;
00212   /// All the infomation about our algorithm, etc.
00213   AnalysisInfo m_Info;
00214   /// Use for writing signals to a buffer. When the buffer is full, write it to CHP files.
00215   affymetrix_calvin_io::CHPMultiDataFileBufferWriter m_GenotypeEntryBufferWriter;
00216   /// Various Chip Summary Data Sources
00217   std::vector<ChipSummary *> m_ChipSummaries;
00218   /// Vector of probeset results which did not fail
00219   /// this is an index into m_Info.m_ProbesetNames
00220   std::vector<int> m_GoodProbesetsExpr;
00221   std::vector<int> m_GoodProbesetsGType;
00222   /// These vectors parallel the ones above, but are indexes
00223   /// into the specific data type section in chp file
00224   std::vector<int> m_GoodProbesetsExprIndex;
00225   std::vector<int> m_GoodProbesetsGTypeIndex;
00226   /// Vector of GUIDs for the respective CEL files
00227   std::vector<std::string> m_celGuids;
00228 
00229   /// put the "chip-view-md5sum" in the header?
00230   /// this is because we need to supress it for legacy sw. *sigh*
00231 public:
00232   bool m_output_chip_view_md5sum;
00233   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *m_ProbeSetsToReport;
00234 
00235 };

00237 #endif /* QUANTMETHODGTYPECCCHPREPORT_H */
